title: RSS is recognised as body of individuals, Bhagwat tells critics

title: The monsoon beats a menacing retreat in Marathwada
content: It has been a month since Marathwada, a drought-prone region, was ravaged by unprecedented floods, leaving 108 people dead and over 45,000 in shelters. Marginal farmers, who form at least 75% of the area‚Äôs farmer population, are the worst affected, many trapped under the burden of debt. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit visits Beed district to find that as farmers wait for government-promised aid, the rabi sowing has been disrupted with the damaged soil and retreating monsoon

However, it is unlikely to make much impact despite the significant Muslim population in Seemanchal. The BJP is making an attempt to change the mood by raising the issue of alleged infiltration.

title: Over 70% of India‚Äôs prisoners have not yet been found guilty: SC judge

content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara has warned jail officials of strict action following major security lapses at Bengaluru Central Jail.

title: 3 ISIS Terrorists Arrested From Gujarat For Planning Attacks In India
content: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Sunday arrested three terrorists linked with ISIS from Ahmedabad for conspiring to carry out terrorist attacks across the country.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Celebrates 36th Birthday During Rally In Bihar's Karakat
content: Grand Alliance chief ministerial candidate and Leader of Opposition in the Bihar Assembly, Tejashwi Yadav, celebrated his 36th birthday on stage during an election rally in Karakat on Sunday.

title: Explained: The 'Land Scam' That Stung Ajit Pawar's Family
content: A political controversy stung Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's family last week over a land deal signed by a company owned by his son, landing the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) in legal trouble and at odds with its ally BJP in Maharashtra.

title: Saikat Chakrabarti: Indian-Origin Democrat In Spotlight After Zohran Mamdani's Win
content: Saikat Chakrabarti leads New Consensus, a policy think tank devoted to developing plans on how the government can achieve economic security and prosperity for all Americans.

title: 2 Class 11 Students Shoot Classmate At Posh Housing Society In Gurugram
content: Two Class 11 students allegedly shot at a classmate with a licensed pistol belonging to the father of one of the accused, at a posh housing society in Gurugram, police said on Sunday.

title: Kerala Orders Probe After Children Sing RSS Song On New Vande Bharat Train
content: The probe was ordered a day after the singing of an RSS song by a group of school students onboard the newly inaugurated Vande Bharat Express.

title: Court Acquits Wife, Lover In Husband's Murder Case Due To Lack Of Evidence
content: A Thane court has acquitted a woman and her paramour accused of murdering her husband in 2018, noting the prosecution failed to prove the case, which was based on circumstantial evidence.

title: Kidnap-Murder Accused Shot In Encounter After Attacking Cops In Bengaluru
content: A man accused in multiple kidnap and murder cases was shot and injured by the Hebbagodi Police during a late-night encounter near Bommasandra crematorium in Bengaluru.

title: Microsoft Apologises To Australians, Offers Refunds Over AI Price Hike
content: Microsoft issued an apology to customers in Australia amid backlash over its pricing. The tech giant sent an email to consumers on Thursday and revealed that it would offer refunds to Microsoft 365 Personal and Family subscribers for the extra costs

title: "Everyone Seems Like Enemy": Tej Pratap Yadav Says His Life's "Under Threat"
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, who recently floated his political outfit after being expelled from the RJD by his father, is contesting from the Mahua constituency in the ongoing Bihar assembly polls.

title: Rape Accused AAP MLA Flees To Australia, Says 'Will Return After Getting Bail'
content: Punjab AAP MLA Harmit Singh Pathanmajra, who has been on the run since September 2 in a rape case, is learnt to have fled to Australia after his appearance in a video interview.

title: Voter List Revision A Bid To Institutionalise 'Vote Theft': Rahul Gandhi
content: The Election Commission officials recently said Rahul Gandhi flags impurities in past polls but opposes special intensive revision aimed at cleaning up the electoral rolls.

title: People Who Drive A Thar Must Be Crazy: Haryana Top Cop
content: Own a Thar or a Bullet? You are making a statement and you're probably crazy, at least according to the Haryana Director General of Police.

title: Japanese PM To Revise Law To Implement Pay Cuts For Herself, Cabinet
content: The newly elected Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is set to introduce a revision to the public servant remuneration law to implement pay cuts for herself and ministers in her cabinet during the ongoing extraordinary session of Parliament.

title: BJP's Fresh Parody Targets Rahul Gandhi, Karnataka Leaders Amid Power Rift
content: The BJP on Sunday released a fresh satirical clip to target the ruling Congress government in Karnataka, amid speculation over growing tussle between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his deputy DK Shivakumar for the top post.

title: 121 Seats, 3.7 Crore Votes, Seemanchal Battle: Decoding Bihar Polls Phase 2
content: The battelines are drawn, positions taken, speeches delivered, and dice cast: in the next few hours, campaigning for the second and last phase of the Assembly polls in Bihar will come to an end. The second phase of polling will take place on Tuesday.

title: Case Against Kerala University Professor For Casteist Remarks Against Scholar
content: The head of the Sanskrit Department at Kerala University has been booked for allegedly making casteist remarks against a research scholar while refusing to sign his thesis, police said on Sunday.

title: Drunk Father Rapes 6-Year-Old Daughter In Uttar Pradesh
content: A man allegedly raped his six-year-old daughter under the influence of alcohol in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor, police said on Sunday.

title: Mehul Choksi-Linked Flats, Silver Bricks Worth Rs 46 Crore Get Auction Nod
content: The 13 properties, which include flats and gems, are estimated to be worth around Rs 46 crore, the order dated November 4 mentioned.

title: After Darshan's viral pic, terror accused seen using smartphones inside Bengaluru jail
content: Videos of prisoners, including serial rapist Umesh Reddy and a terror case accused, using mobile phones inside Bengaluru's Central Prison have surfaced. This security lapse has prompted an inquiry into how the phones were provided and who is involved. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has ordered a report and action against those responsible.

title: ‚ÄòThey were holding a grudge‚Äô: Teen shoots schoolmate with father‚Äôs pistol; 2 minors arrested
content: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

title: IGIA ATC glitch ‚Äî 'Critical need to prioritise modernisation': Air traffic managers raise red flag
content: Air traffic professionals are demanding urgent modernization of communication, navigation, and surveillance systems at major Indian airports, citing a recent Delhi ATC shutdown due to outdated technology. The Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel Association (ATSEPA) and the Air Traffic Controllers‚Äô Guild have repeatedly warned aviation authorities about systemic imbalances and the neglect of technical advice, impacting operational efficiency and safety margins amidst rapid air traffic growth.

title: IPL 2026 auction likely on Dec 15: WPL mega sale on Nov 27; big names released
content: The IPL 2026 auction is slated for December 15, with a potential return to India for the venue. Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League auction is scheduled for November 27 in Delhi, featuring key retentions and notable releases ahead of the event. This will be the first mega auction of the WPL since the inaugural auction.

title: Pakistan‚Äôs manufacturing sector slumps; experts warn of long-term industrial decay
content: Pakistan's manufacturing sector faces a severe crisis, with private investment plummeting 46% in six years. Experts warn of industrial disintegration due to policy instability, high energy costs, and volatile currency. This decline threatens exports, jobs, and economic resilience, contrasting sharply with neighboring countries' growth.

title: US layoffs reach 20-year high in Oct: 10 companies that cut thousands of jobs
content: October 2025 saw a staggering 153,074 job cuts, the highest in over two decades, driven by AI adoption and cost-cutting. Major tech and retail giants like Amazon, UPS, Intel, and Target announced significant layoffs. This surge, a 183% jump from September, signals deepening labor market concerns and a stark contrast to hiring trends.

title: ‚ÄòEven Hindu Dharma is not registered‚Äô: Mohan Bhagwat addresses row
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat defended the organization's status as a body of individuals, questioning the need for registration with the British government and highlighting post-independence recognition. He also addressed the 'Love Jihad' concept, attributing its perceived success to a failure in imparting Hindu values to children, while cautioning against generalizing about the Muslim community.

title: ‚ÄòGet out‚Äô: When Harvard student told Bezos to sell Amazon; founder shares anecdote
content: A Harvard student once advised Amazon founder Jeff Bezos to sell his nascent company to Barnes & Noble, just before its 1997 IPO. Bezos, however, doubled down on his internet vision, transforming Amazon into a global tech giant. Meanwhile, Barnes & Noble, focused on physical retail, is now reportedly exploring an IPO after a modest revival.

title: 'Saare badmash issi pe chalte hain': Haryana top cop on Thar, bullet bike
content: Haryana's top police officer, OP Singh, identified Mahindra Thars and Bullet motorcycles as high-risk vehicles often associated with reckless driving and rogue elements. He emphasized polite police checks and warned that drivers of these vehicles, along with high-performance cars, will face scrutiny. Singh also announced plans to bolster the state's cyber police unit.

title: ‚ÄòEveryone seems like an enemy‚Äô: Tej Pratap Yadav claims ‚Äòthreat to life‚Äô; security beefed up
content: Janshakti Janta Dal Chief Tej Pratap Yadav stated his security has been enhanced due to a threat to his life. He confirmed the increased security in Patna, citing personal danger. Sources suggest local intelligence inputs prompted the measure, though officials have not yet commented.

title: Canada‚Äôs $1.2 bn plan to woo H-1B visa holders; reveals new immigration plan
content: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: IND vs AUS: Washington Sundar handed special award after series win - watch
content: Washington Sundar was named 'Impact Player of the Series' for his consistent performances in India's T20I victory over Australia. He showcased his versatility with a match-winning 49 off 23 balls in one game and a crucial three-wicket burst in another, securing the series for India. He was in the XI for the final T20I but did not feature since the match was called off.

title: Uttarakhand infra boost: PM Modi unveils over Rs 8,000 cr projects in Dehradun
content: Uttarakhand celebrated its Silver Jubilee with Prime Minister Modi inaugurating development projects worth over Rs 8,140 crore. Key initiatives include water supply, energy, sports, and education, alongside a Rs 62 crore direct transfer to over 28,000 farmers. The PM also released a commemorative postal stamp, marking a significant milestone for the state.

title: World Cup magic: Kranti Gaud's win helps her father reclaim lost honour
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women‚Äôs World Cup‚Äìwinning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti‚Äôs felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

title: 'Feels like betrayal': Amazon recruiter laid off; AI reshapes job security
content: Global tech giants are restructuring their workforces, impacting thousands of white-collar jobs. Companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta are prioritizing AI and automation, leading to layoffs in roles once considered secure.  This shift emphasizes efficiency over loyalty, forcing professionals to adapt.  The future of work demands continuous learning and adaptability as AI reshapes industries and job roles.

title: West Bengal: 4-year-old girl kidnapped, found bleeding near Kolkata; grandfather arrested
content: A four-year-old child was found severely injured near Tarakeshwar railway station after being abducted from her home. Her grandfather has been arrested in connection with the incident. Allegations of delayed police action and a potential sexual assault have led to protests and a renewed investigation.

title: Indore: ‚ÄòDrunk‚Äô ASI rams SUV into multiple bikes, kills man; eyewitnesses describe moment
content: A police officer in Neemuch has been suspended and arrested for a fatal crash that killed a teacher and critically injured four others, including his own family. The assistant sub-inspector allegedly drove his SUV into multiple vehicles. Eyewitnesses reported he was heavily intoxicated, with liquor bottles found in his car. The victim's family protested, demanding justice.

title: ‚ÄòI was trying to rub my back‚Äô: Rapido driver to cops in Bengaluru molestation case
content: A Rapido bike-taxi captain was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman passenger in Bengaluru. The accused claimed he was rubbing his aching back, but the victim stated he continued touching her leg despite her objections. Police registered a case after the woman narrated her ordeal on Instagram.

title: 'What‚Äôs the problem?': German tourist harassed by local cabbies in Goa; taxi-app turf war deepens
content: A German travel influencer faced harassment in Goa when local rickshaw drivers demanded an exorbitant fare, forcing him to use the app-based GoaMiles. The situation escalated with threats, police intervention, and a fine for the GoaMiles driver, highlighting a growing turf war impacting tourism.

title: ‚ÄòWar‚Äôs most challenging night‚Äô: Ukraine‚Äôs power generation at ‚Äòzero‚Äô
content: Russia launched a massive wave of drone and missile strikes, crippling Ukraine's energy infrastructure and reducing power generation to zero.  The state power company reported its facilities were completely knocked out, leading to widespread, prolonged power outages across multiple regions as repairs continue.

title: From toasted to roasted: Trump wines sales in military cantonments invite flak
content: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: Why experts call calf muscles the body‚Äôs ‚Äòsecond heart‚Äô & 5 ways to keep them strong
content: A powerful muscle in the lower body quietly supports the heart‚Äôs work every single day. Experts say it plays a far greater role in circulation and vitality than most people realise.

title: IPO rush ahead! 5 issues to hit the market eyeing Rs 10,000 cr ‚Äî What to know
content: Get ready for a busy IPO week as five companies prepare to raise over Rs 10,000 crore. From edtech giant PhysicsWallah to automotive component maker Tenneco Clean Air India and solar firm Emmvee Photovoltaic Power, the mainboard sees significant action. Two smaller firms, Mahamaya Lifesciences and Workmates Core2Cloud Solution, will also launch on the SME platform, testing market appetite.

title: 'It's T20, but he still... ': South Africa legend praises Rohit; leaves out Kohli
content: Former South African captain Hashim Amla has lauded Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma, naming him among his top T20 batters on the planet at the moment. Amla's glowing remarks, shared in a recent interview, have gained significant traction online. The veteran is anticipated to rejoin the Indian squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, commencing November 30.

title: 'No gimmicks, secret lies in...': At 60, Milind Soman‚Äôs fitness rules are simple
content: Milind Soman, the ageless fitness icon, reveals his simple approach to staying lean and energetic at 60. He prioritizes functionality over gym routines, focusing on 10-15 minutes of daily exercise, outdoor activities, and bodyweight workouts. His diet consists of fresh, home-cooked meals, avoiding processed foods. Soman emphasizes consistency and respecting the body's natural rhythm for long-term wellness.

title: Mumbai: Man assaults 3 Cooper Hospital doctors after mother‚Äôs death
content: Chaos unfolded at Cooper Hospital following the death of a patient, as the medical staff faced aggression from the deceased's son, leading to an assault on two doctors and an intern. In response, many resident doctors have chosen to go on mass casual leave, voicing their frustrations and fears.

title: Bengaluru rapido driver who 'tried to grab woman's legs' arrested
content: A 28-year-old Rapido bike-taxi driver was apprehended in Bengaluru for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman during a ride. The victim shared her ordeal on Instagram, detailing how the driver attempted to grab her legs. Police initiated a case after her complaint, and the accused claims he was trying to rub his back.

title: Uniformity vs identity: State anthem mandatory in WB schools; Darjeeling opts out
content: West Bengal's mandate for schools to sing the state anthem sparked pushback in Darjeeling, where the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration insisted on maintaining local Nepali anthems and prayers. This highlights how daily school rituals become arenas for negotiating language, identity, and belonging, revealing that shared citizenship doesn't necessitate uniform cultural symbols.

title: RBSE to conduct board exams twice a year from 2026‚Äë27
content: Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) will conduct board exams twice a year for Class 10 and 12 students starting from the 2026-27 academic session. The first exam is compulsory, while the second, optional session allows students to improve marks in up to three subjects, with the best performance considered for final results.

title: Asia Cup: ‚ÄòFeels great to finally get to touch the trophy,‚Äô says Suryakumar Yadav
content: The Indian team had earlier declined to receive the Asia Cup winner‚Äôs trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who also serves as the Asian Cricket Council chairperson, citing his anti-India stance. Efforts are now underway to resolve the trophy dispute, with representatives from both cricket boards having met recently in Dubai.

title: ‚ÄòSame method in MP, Chhattisgarh‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi escalates ‚Äòvote theft‚Äô charge; hits out at BJP, EC
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi claims the BJP has stolen votes in Haryana and other states. He alleges a centralized plan involving PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the Election Commission. Gandhi presented data on fake voter entries and duplicate photos. The BJP dismissed the claims as baseless and an attempt to defame institutions.

title: Jaipur horror: Man bludgeoned to death with grinding stone, pestle by enraged wife
content: A 40-year-old technician was allegedly murdered by his wife in Jaipur during a domestic dispute. The 32-year-old accused reportedly used a grinding stone and pestle to strike her husband on the head, leading to his death. Neighbours alerted by the commotion transported the victim to the hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival.

title: Babar Azam hits mega milestone! Joins Viv, Azharuddin and Cook in exclusive list
content: Pakistan‚Äôs star batter Babar Azam added another feather to his illustrious career by completing 15,000 international runs during the third ODI against South Africa on Saturday. The milestone came in the series decider at Iqbal Stadium, Faisalabad, making Babar only the fifth Pakistani to achieve the landmark.

title: Pune man strangles wife, burns body in iron box; read crime novels before murder
content: A Pune businessman, inspired by crime fiction, meticulously planned and executed his wife's murder after suspecting an affair. He strangled her, cremated the body in a custom iron box, and scattered the ashes. Inconsistencies in his statements and call records ultimately led to his arrest, unraveling his chilling plot.

title: Death at dawn: 23-year-old dies as car rams parked truck in Ahmedabad; 2 women injured
content: A tragic early morning accident on SG Road claimed the life of 23-year-old Aryan Batra after his speeding car collided with a stationary truck. Two 21-year-old women, passengers in Batra's car, were seriously injured, with one remaining unconscious. Police are investigating the circumstances, including the direction of travel and potential party attendance.

title: Tampa tragedy: Speeding car fleeing police ploughs into crowd; four dead, 11 injured
content: A speeding car fleeing police crashed into a crowd outside a Tampa bar, killing four and injuring eleven. The driver, Silas Sampson, was attempting to evade law enforcement after street racing. This tragic incident has prompted renewed discussion on police pursuit policies.

title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal welcome baby boy; Karan Johar extends his wishes
content: Bollywood stars Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have joyfully welcomed their first child, a baby boy, into the world. The news was met with widespread congratulations from friends, family, and industry colleagues, including filmmaker Karan Johar. Vicky's brother, Sunny Kaushal, expressed his excitement about becoming an uncle, while Vicky's father, Sham Kaushal, shared his profound gratitude for the blessings.

title: It‚Äôs not your belly! Doctor reveals the surprising first sign of weight gain
content: Weight gain begins subtly inside the body, with the tongue being the first area to accumulate fat. This internal fat buildup can lead to snoring, the initial observable sign of weight gain, even in individuals who are not visibly overweight. This phenomenon has been observed in studies, highlighting snoring as a potential indicator of developing obesity.

title: ‚ÄòWill be back‚Äô: PM Modi wraps up Bihar campaign; warns against ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô return
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his Bihar election campaign with a confident address, promising to return for the NDA government's swearing-in ceremony. He highlighted welfare schemes, women's empowerment, and development initiatives, while also taking swipes at opposition leaders and their past governance.

title: 4-day school week gets community nod as Missouri voters back pilot districts
content: Two Missouri school districts, Independence and Hallsville, have overwhelmingly won voter approval to continue their four-day school weeks. This marks a significant shift under a new law requiring public consent for non-rural districts. The move is seen as a boost for teacher recruitment and retention, with educators citing improved work-life balance and planning time.

title: Sussanne Khan pens emotional tribute to mom Zarine Khan: ‚ÄòYou took our hearts‚Äô
content: Zarine Khan, wife of veteran actor Sanjay Khan and mother to Sussanne and Farah Khan Ali, passed away at 81. Her daughters shared deeply emotional tributes, remembering her grace, love, and as their guiding light. Zarine Khan's funeral was conducted according to Hindu traditions, attended by close family and friends.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs ‚Äògoodbye‚Äô text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Every team's current pace vs. preseason projections
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this edition of the Power Rankings will be taking a look at the preseason over/under point totals compared to each team's current points pace .

title: The Big Ten offers beautiful drama in Week 11
content: the big Ten is the sport's chief exporter of cheese, beef and punts . it's not that the Big Ten doesn't have good games, necessarily . the drama often feels more "Masterpiece Theater" than "Alien vs. Predator"

title: Week 11 intel: Auburn fallout, Texas' moves and biggest visits
content: the recruiting trail has heated up this week as the clock ticks down on the 2026 class . title: Flying private jets is no longer just for the ultra-rich
content: private jet deliveries are up since the Covid-19 pandemic travel slump . there are around 23,500 private jets in service globally . in 2020, there were 644 business-jet deliveries . by 2024, this jumped to 764 .

title: 13 more Week 10 games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: Izzo guides Michigan St. past Calipari, Arkansas
content: no. 22 Michigan State beat no. 14 Arkansas 69-66 in a matchup of Hall of Fame coaches . the Spartans grabbed 19 offensive rebounds and converted them into 18 points . freshmen darius Acuff Jr. and Meleek Thomas scored 16 points on 5 of 16 shooting .
